comment.author: 59158873@N05
comment._content: I have a letter written on letterhead stationary dated 1926 written by a salesman that worked for the company I am retired from. It sais "THE POWERS HOTEL" ROCHESTER, N.Y. In smaller type it also sais J. Messner, President and Manager. also "COMFORT, CONVENIENCE, COURTESY.

comment.author: 90731784@N07
comment._content:
The Powers Hotel on the corner of Plymouth and Main was a place of style & prestige, I lived in the Powers Hotel in 1958, it served as housing for first years students of Rochester Institute of Technology, a fellow student by the name of Benware was dismissed for he was found to be the cause of firecrackers tossed in the lobby.  The second year, I resided at the "Old Brick Church", economical housing for RIT students.  Rochester New York was a magnificent specimen in those days. 
Felix
